ref: 9742 máṇḍala n. ʻ disc ʼ ŚBr., ʻ ball for playing ʼ MBh., ʻ circle, district ʼ AVPariś., adj. ʻ circular ʼ VarBr̥S., maṇḍalaka -- n. ʻ disc ʼ Yājñ., ˚likā -- f. ʻ group ʼ Śiś. 2. *mandala -- . 3. *maṇḍa -- 7 (in maṇḍacaravant<-> ʻ having a noose ʼ BaudhŚr.?). 4. *manda -- . [P. Tedesco's derivation (JAOS 65, 84) from *vr̥tta -- la -- is phonet. unacceptable. Variation of ṇḍ with nd, if the words in Bshk. Tor. K. for ʻ thigh ʼ belong, supports non -- Aryan origin, for which T. Burrow's proposal (BSOAS xii 389) of Drav. *mŏṇḍale (> Tam. muṭalai ʻ globe, ball ʼ) is attractive]
Pa. maṇḍala -- m. ʻ circle, disc of sun or moon ʼ;
Pk. maṁḍala -- n. ʻ circle, round fence, country ʼ, ˚lī -- f. ʻ circle ʼ;
pers. mandal ʻ village ʼ;
pers. mandal ʻ village ʼ;
Paš. māndar ʻ flat stone, flagstone ʼ (IIFL iii 3, 123 with?);
urt. māṇḍal ʻ coffin ʼ,
urt. māṇḍal ʻ coffin ʼ,
rumb. māṇḍau, obl. st. māṇḍal -- ;
K. manḍul, dat. ˚ḍalas m. ʻ circle ʼ, manḍüjü f. ʻ group sitting in a circle ʼ;
L. mannlā m. ʻ lid of a churn ʼ;
P. maṇḍal m. ʻ circle, orb, disc of sun or moon ʼ, maṇḍlī f. ʻ assembly ʼ;
N. maṛeuli ʻ woman who with others carries a chowrie and encircles the pitcher in marriage procession ʼ < *maṛaleuli deriv. of *maṛali;
A. māral ʻ inner reception room in women's quarters ʼ, māral -- ghar ʻ outer house for sitting or working in ʼ;
Or. maṇḍaḷa, muṇḍuḷā, ˚ḷī ʻ circle ʼ, maḷā ʻ circle, ring of straw to stand pots on, basin at foot of tree ʼ (< *mãṛḷā?);
Mth. maṛarā ʻ slip of bamboo round edge of winnowing basket ʼ, mã̄ṛari ʻ circle, circle round moon ʼ, (SBhagalpur) maṛro ʻ iron ring round block of sugar mill ʼ;
H. mãḍal m. ʻ disc of sun or moon ʼ (←
Sk.?), mãḍlī f. ʻ circle, disc, ring ʼ; O
G. māṁdaliiṁ loc. sg. ʻ circle ʼ;
M. mãḍaḷ n. ʻ circle ʼ, mã̄ḍaḷ f. ʻ ring round head of pestle or similar tool ʼ, mã̄ḍḷī, f. ʻ circular stack of sheaves ʼ; O
Si. man̆ḍula,
Si. maḍulla, st. ˚ḍulu -- , mäḍilla, st. ˚ḍili -- ʻ ring, circle, circular hall ʼ;
